channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2024110166
item.description:
Report X-2024110166

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-31
  • City: OSHKOSH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE HAD VISIBLE FROST FORMING AND WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS REVEALS APPROXIMATELY TEN POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING PIZZAS. THE THERMAL TRACKING LABEL HAS A SHIPPER CONTACT NAME OF JULIE NIMKIE. OUTER BOX HAS FRAGILE AND PERISHABLE WRITTEN ON IT WITH A BLACK MARKER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024110015
item.description:
Report E-2024110015

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-06T12:32:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-28
  • City: MARSHFIELD
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 28, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3264 leaked in transit and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EXE) to remediate the impacted site. EX personnel utilized absorbent pads and soda ash to remediate the impacted trailer. Crews tightened the cap and secured the 55-gallon drum of UN3264 for further shipment and transport. All PPE and spent absorbents were collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and take offsite by EX personnel.
